strings.Value: [Pour water from the vessel into the pond] "This is also a part of the riddle. About fear poisoning the soul with despair."
"It was part of the riddle of the Lantern King — to poison the pond, that is 'to poison the soul with despair'."

{n}Ghostly Nyrissa stands at the edge of the water.{/n} "This place... I remember it so well. Here I wept over my defeat — after my judgment, after the curse... But everything has changed! The pond seems poisoned..."
{n}A soft smile touches Nyrissa's lips.{/n} "I treasure the gift I received from you. — Hope for the better, faith in the future. It's more powerful than any despair."
{n}In response to your actions and the nymph's words, the water in the pond boils for a moment, then calms down and clears, cleansed of all poison. A set of bird bones materializes in your hands.{/n}
"I'm surprised at how carefully the {g|Eldest}Eldest{/g} watched me, and how deeply into my soul he looked. What did he hope to achieve? Just an elaborate performance? Riddles, just riddles..."
